revised_title: A Description of the Aurora Borealis Observed in Southwick, Northamptonshire
tldr: The author, George Lynn, describes an observation of the Aurora Borealis in Southwick, Northamptonshire, detailing its appearance, form, and various phenomena, including a white arch and a glory with rays extending from east to west. The event lasted for several nights and was visible even with the use of a telescope.
